content:
TITLE: Installing Dependencies and Initial Setup Commands
DESCRIPTION: Basic commands for installing pnpm globally, cloning the repository, and setting up the development environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/advanced/development/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install -g pnpm
cd homarr
pnpm install
pnpm run docker:dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Code Quality and Testing Commands
DESCRIPTION: Commands for running linters, formatters, tests, and type checking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/advanced/development/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm lint
pnpm format:fix
pnpm test
pnpm test:ui
pnpm typecheck
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Homarr with Docker Standalone
DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to install Homarr as a standalone container. Sets up necessary volume mounts for configuration persistence, exposes port 7575, and includes essential environment variables for encryption.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/getting-started/installation/docker.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run  \
  --name homarr \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 7575:7575 \
  -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
  -v <your-path>/homarr/appdata:/appdata \
  -e SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY='your_64_character_hex_string' \
  -d ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Homarr in Docker Standalone Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Homarr as a standalone Docker container. This creates a container named 'homarr' that restarts automatically unless stopped, maps port 7575, and mounts the necessary volumes for Docker socket and application data. Requires setting a secret encryption key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/docs/getting-started/installation/docker.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run  \
  --name homarr \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 7575:7575 \
  -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
  -v <your-path>/homarr/appdata:/appdata \
  -e SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY='your_64_character_hex_string' \
  -d ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Homarr Container with Docker Standalone
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Homarr using standalone Docker. It configures the container with required volumes, ports, and environment variables. The command mounts the Docker socket and a local directory for persistent storage, and sets a secret encryption key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/getting-started/installation/docker.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run  \
  --name homarr \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 7575:7575 \
  -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
  -v <your-path>/homarr/appdata:/appdata \
  -e SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY='your_64_character_hex_string' \
  -d ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Helm Chart Values for Homarr Deployment
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration defines various parameters for deploying Homarr using a Helm chart. It includes settings for RBAC, health checks, replication, resource allocation, security context, service configuration, and deployment strategy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.15.0/getting-started/installation/helm.md#2025-04-17_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
rbac:
  enabled: false
readinessProbe:
  httpGet:
    path: "/api/health/ready"
    port: 7575
replicaCount: 1
resources: {}
securityContext: {}
service:
  enabled: true
  ports:
    app:
      port: 7575
      protocol: "TCP"
      targetPort: "http"
  type: "ClusterIP"
strategyType: "RollingUpdate"
tolerations: []
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Authelia OIDC Client Configuration for Homarr
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for setting up an OIDC client in Authelia for Homarr. Defines client ID, secret, redirect URIs, and required scopes for authentication.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
identity_providers:
oidc:
...
clients:
- id: homarr
  secret: <secret_hash>
  public: false
  authorization_policy: one_factor
  redirect_uris:
  - https://example.com/api/auth/callback/oidc
  - http://localhost:3000/api/auth/callback/oidc
  scopes:
  - openid
  - groups
  - profile
  - email
  userinfo_signing_algorithm: none
  consent_mode: implicit # self hosted
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose for Homarr with User Permissions
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for running Homarr with custom user permissions using PUID and PGID environment variables. The configuration mounts an appdata volume and sets the necessary environment variables including the encryption key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/advanced/running-as-different-user/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#     Homarr - A simple, yet powerful dashboard for your server.      #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
        - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
        - PUID=1000
        - PGID=1000
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose for Homarr 1.0 Beta
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for deploying Homarr 1.0 beta. Includes container settings, volume mounts for Docker integration and app data, environment variables for encryption, and port mapping. Requires a 64-character hex string for SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY which can be generated using openssl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/blog/2024/12-17-open-beta-1.0/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#     Homarr - A simple, yet powerful dashboard for your server.      #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:beta
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock # Optional, only if you want docker integration
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker Build and Run Commands
DESCRIPTION: Commands for building and running the project using Docker
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/docs/advanced/development/getting-started.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: docker
CODE:
```
docker build -t homarr .
docker run -p 7575:7575 -e SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY='your_64_character_hex_string' homarr:latest
```

TITLE: Running Homarr Container with Docker Standalone
DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to create and start a Homarr container with necessary volume mounts, port mapping, and environment variables. Requires Docker installation and proper file system permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/getting-started/installation/docker.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run  \
  --name homarr \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 7575:7575 \
  -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
  -v <your-path>/homarr/appdata:/appdata \
  -e SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY='your_64_character_hex_string' \
  -d ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Homarr Environment Variables for Azure AD OIDC Integration
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables for connecting Homarr to Azure AD using OIDC. Includes tenant-specific issuer URL, client credentials, and settings for mapping Azure app roles to Homarr permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: docker
CODE:
```
AUTH_PROVIDERS="oidc"
AUTH_OIDC_ISSUER="https://login.microsoftonline.com/<teanant-id>/v2.0"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_SECRET="<client-secret>"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_ID="<client-id>"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_NAME="Azure"
AUTH_OIDC_SCOPE_OVERWRITE="openid email profile" # Groups scope does not exist in azure
AUTH_OIDC_GROUPS_ATTRIBUTE="roles" # We use the roles of the app registration so that we don't need to use uuids as our groups
```

```
    environment:
```

TITLE: LDAP Authentication Docker Compose Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for setting up LDAP authentication in Homarr, showing environment variables configuration for connecting to an LLDAP server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
#Docker compose
version: x
services:
  homarr:
    environment:
      AUTH_PROVIDERS: ldap
      AUTH_LDAP_URI: ldap://example.com:3890
      AUTH_LDAP_BASE: dc=example,dc=com #Same as LLDAP_LDAP_BASE_DN
      AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN: uid=admin,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com
      AUTH_LDAP_BIND_PASSWORD: adminpass #Same as LLDAP_LDAP_USER_PASS
```

TITLE: Allowing Self-Signed Certificates in Homarr Docker Run Command
DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to start Homarr with the NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED environment variable set to 0, allowing self-signed certificates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

  --name homarr \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 7575:7575 \
  -v ./homarr/appdata:/appdata \
  -e NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 \
  -e SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string \
  -d ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
```

TITLE: Traefik Integration Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for running Homarr behind Traefik reverse proxy with network and label configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - BASE_URL=your.internal.dns.address.here.com
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string
    networks:
      - proxy
    labels:
      traefik.enable: true
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.rule: Host(`your.internal.dns.address.here.com`)
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.entrypoints: websecure
      traefik.http.routers.homarr-secure.app: homarr
      traefik.http.apps.homarr.loadbalancer.server.port: 7575

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Securing Homarr with Caddy Reverse Proxy
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for setting up Caddy as a reverse proxy for Homarr. The configuration includes network settings, volume mounts, and port forwarding for Caddy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  
  # <-- [Homarr installation]

  caddy:
    container_name: caddy
    image: caddy:2
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 443:443
      - 443:443/udp
    volumes:
      - ./Caddyfile:/etc/caddy/Caddyfile
      - caddy_data:/data
      - caddy_config:/config
    networks:
      - proxy

volumes:
  caddy_data:
  caddy_config:

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Installing Homarr with Standalone Docker
DESCRIPTION: A Docker run command to install Homarr as a standalone container. It sets up container name, restart policy, port mapping, volume mounts, and environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.15.0/getting-started/installation/docker.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run  \
  --name homarr \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 7575:7575 \
  -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
  -v <your-path>/homarr/appdata:/appdata \
```

TITLE: Traefik-Enabled Homarr Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for running Homarr behind Traefik proxy with necessary labels and network configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.15.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - BASE_URL=your.internal.dns.address.here.com
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string
    networks:
      - proxy
    labels:
      traefik.enable: true
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.rule: Host(`your.internal.dns.address.here.com`)
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.entrypoints: websecure
      traefik.http.routers.homarr-secure.app: homarr
      traefik.http.apps.homarr.loadbalancer.server.port: 7575

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Traefik with Cloudflare for Certificate Generation
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Traefik using Cloudflare for certificate generation, compatible with the Homarr setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'

apps:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:latest
    container_name: traefik
    restart: unless-stopped
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    networks:
      - proxy
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 443:443
    environment:
      - CF_API_EMAIL=yourcfemail@here.com
      - CF_DNS_API_TOKEN=long-token-from-cf

    command:
      - "--log.level=DEBUG"
      - "--providers.docker=true"
      - "--providers.docker.exposedbydefault=false"
      - "--providers.docker.endpoint=unix:///var/run/docker.sock"
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.to=websecure"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.scheme=https"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entrypoint.permanent=true"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.http.tls.certResolver=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesresolvers.cloudflare.acme.storage=acme.json"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.email=yourcfemail@here.com"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnsChallenge=true"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.provider=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.resolvers=1.1.1.1:53,1.0.0.1:53"
      - "--serversTransport.insecureSkipVerify=true" # Or proxmox gives an error 500 due to its own self-signed cert

    volumes:
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
      - ./data/acme.json:/acme.json

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Defining Kind Cluster Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for creating a three-node Kubernetes cluster with one control plane and two worker nodes, including resource reservation settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.15.0/advanced/development/kubernetes.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat > kind-config.yaml <<EOF
# three node (two workers) cluster config
kind: Cluster
apiVersion: kind.x-k8s.io/v1alpha4
nodes:
- role: control-plane
  kubeadmConfigPatches:
    - |
      kind: KubeletConfiguration
      apiVersion: kubelet.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
      kubeReserved:
        cpu: "250m"
        memory: "256Mi"
      systemReserved:
        cpu: "500m"
        memory: "512Mi"
      evictionHard:
        memory.available: "200Mi"
- role: worker
- role: worker
EOF
```

```
docker ps | grep homarr
```

LANGUAGE: bash

```
docker exec -it <container-id> /bin/bash homarr <your-command-goes-here>
```

TITLE: Configuring Helm Chart Parameters for Homarr Labs Documentation
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration defines various parameters for deploying Homarr Labs documentation using a Helm chart. It includes settings for RBAC, health checks, replication, resource allocation, security contexts, service configuration, and deployment strategies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/getting-started/installation/helm.md#2025-04-17_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
rbac.enabled: false
readinessProbe:
  httpGet:
    path: "/api/health/ready"
    port: 7575
replicaCount: 1
resources: {}
securityContext: {}
service:
  enabled: true
  ports:
    app:
      port: 7575
      protocol: "TCP"
      targetPort: "http"
  type: "ClusterIP"
strategyType: "RollingUpdate"
tolerations: []
```

TITLE: Configuring LDAP Authentication with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration example for setting up Homarr with LDAP authentication. This snippet shows how to specify the necessary environment variables for connecting to an LDAP server in a Docker Compose file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/docs/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
#Docker compose
version: x
services:
  homarr:
    environment:
      AUTH_PROVIDERS: ldap
      AUTH_LDAP_URI: ldap://example.com:3890
      AUTH_LDAP_BASE: dc=example,dc=com #Same as LLDAP_LDAP_BASE_DN
      AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN: uid=admin,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com
      AUTH_LDAP_BIND_PASSWORD: adminpass #Same as LLDAP_LDAP_USER_PASS
```

TITLE: Deploying Homarr Dashboard with Docker Compose in Portainer
DESCRIPTION: This Docker Compose configuration creates a Homarr dashboard container with persistent storage and optional Docker integration. It requires setting an encryption key and specifies port 7575 for web access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/docs/getting-started/installation/portainer.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yml
CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#     Homarr - A simple, yet powerful dashboard for your server.      #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock # Optional, only if you want docker integration
      - <your-path>/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose for Custom User Permissions
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for running Homarr with custom user and group IDs using PUID and PGID environment variables. Includes volume mounting for appdata and basic container configuration.

CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#     Homarr - A simple, yet powerful dashboard for your server.      #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
        - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
        - PUID=1000
        - PGID=1000
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

TITLE: Securing Homarr with Caddy in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for using Caddy as a reverse proxy for Homarr. Includes volume and network configurations for proper integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  
  # <-- [Homarr installation]

  caddy:
    container_name: caddy
    image: caddy:2
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 443:443
      - 443:443/udp
    volumes:
      - ./Caddyfile:/etc/caddy/Caddyfile
      - caddy_data:/data
      - caddy_config:/config
    networks:
      - proxy

volumes:
  caddy_data:
  caddy_config:

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Creating Kind Cluster Configuration with Multiple Nodes
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for a kind Kubernetes cluster with one control-plane node and two worker nodes. Includes resource reservations and eviction settings for the control plane.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/development/kubernetes.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat > kind-config.yaml <<EOF
# three node (two workers) cluster config
kind: Cluster
apiVersion: kind.x-k8s.io/v1alpha4
nodes:
- role: control-plane
  kubeadmConfigPatches:
    - |
      kind: KubeletConfiguration
      apiVersion: kubelet.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
      kubeReserved:
        cpu: "250m"
        memory: "256Mi"
      systemReserved:
        cpu: "500m"
        memory: "512Mi"
      evictionHard:
        memory.available: "200Mi"
- role: worker
- role: worker
EOF
```

TITLE: Traefik Proxy Configuration with Cloudflare
DESCRIPTION: Complete Traefik configuration using Cloudflare for certificate generation, including DNS challenge setup and security options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.15.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'

apps:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:latest
    container_name: traefik
    restart: unless-stopped
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    networks:
      - proxy
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 443:443
    environment:
      - CF_API_EMAIL=yourcfemail@here.com
      - CF_DNS_API_TOKEN=long-token-from-cf
    command:
      - "--log.level=DEBUG"
      - "--providers.docker=true"
      - "--providers.docker.exposedbydefault=false"
      - "--providers.docker.endpoint=unix:///var/run/docker.sock"
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.to=websecure"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.scheme=https"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entrypoint.permanent=true"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.http.tls.certResolver=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesresolvers.cloudflare.acme.storage=acme.json"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.email=yourcfemail@here.com"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnsChallenge=true"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.provider=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.resolvers=1.1.1.1:53,1.0.0.1:53"
      - "--serversTransport.insecureSkipVerify=true"
    volumes:
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
      - ./data/acme.json:/acme.json

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Configuring Ingress for Homarr
DESCRIPTION: Values file configuration to set up Ingress for Homarr, including service enablement, ingress class, host configuration, path settings, and TLS certificates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/getting-started/installation/helm.md#2025-04-17_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
service:
  enabled: true # Ensure the service is enabled for Ingress to route traffic
ingress:
  enabled: true
  ingressClassName: "traefik"
  annotations:
  # Add any additional annotations as needed
  hosts:
    - host: homarr.homelab.dev
      paths:
        - path: /
          pathType: ImplementationSpecific
  tls:
    - hosts:
```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
identity_providers:
oidc:
...
clients:
- id: homarr
  secret: <secret_hash>
  public: false
  authorization_policy: one_factor
  redirect_uris:
  - https://example.com/api/auth/callback/oidc
  - http://localhost:3000/api/auth/callback/oidc

  - openid
  - groups
  - profile
  - email
  userinfo_signing_algorithm: none

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Traefik Configuration with Cloudflare DNS Challenge
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Traefik with Cloudflare DNS challenge for automatic SSL certificate generation. Includes network configuration for integration with other services.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'

apps:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:latest
    container_name: traefik
    restart: unless-stopped
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    networks:
      - proxy
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 443:443
    environment:
      - CF_API_EMAIL=yourcfemail@here.com
      - CF_DNS_API_TOKEN=long-token-from-cf

    command:
      - "--log.level=DEBUG"
      - "--providers.docker=true"
      - "--providers.docker.exposedbydefault=false"
      - "--providers.docker.endpoint=unix:///var/run/docker.sock"
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.to=websecure"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.scheme=https"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entrypoint.permanent=true"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.http.tls.certResolver=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesresolvers.cloudflare.acme.storage=acme.json"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.email=yourcfemail@here.com"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnsChallenge=true"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.provider=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.resolvers=1.1.1.1:53,1.0.0.1:53"
      - "--serversTransport.insecureSkipVerify=true" # Or proxmox gives an error 500 due to its own self-signed cert

    volumes:
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
      - ./data/acme.json:/acme.json

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Configuring Multi-Node Kubernetes Cluster
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for creating a three-node Kubernetes cluster with one control plane and two workers, including resource reservation settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/advanced/development/kubernetes.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat > kind-config.yaml <<EOF
# three node (two workers) cluster config
kind: Cluster
apiVersion: kind.x-k8s.io/v1alpha4
nodes:
- role: control-plane
  kubeadmConfigPatches:
    - |
      kind: KubeletConfiguration
      apiVersion: kubelet.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
      kubeReserved:
        cpu: "250m"
        memory: "256Mi"
      systemReserved:
        cpu: "500m"
        memory: "512Mi"
      evictionHard:
        memory.available: "200Mi"
- role: worker
- role: worker
EOF
```

TITLE: Traefik Docker Configuration with Cloudflare
DESCRIPTION: Complete Traefik configuration with Cloudflare DNS challenge for SSL certificates and security settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'

apps:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:latest
    container_name: traefik
    restart: unless-stopped
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    networks:
      - proxy
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 443:443
    environment:
      - CF_API_EMAIL=yourcfemail@here.com
      - CF_DNS_API_TOKEN=long-token-from-cf
    command:
      - "--log.level=DEBUG"
      - "--providers.docker=true"
      - "--providers.docker.exposedbydefault=false"
      - "--providers.docker.endpoint=unix:///var/run/docker.sock"
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.to=websecure"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.scheme=https"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entrypoint.permanent=true"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.http.tls.certResolver=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesresolvers.cloudflare.acme.storage=acme.json"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.email=yourcfemail@here.com"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnsChallenge=true"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.provider=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.resolvers=1.1.1.1:53,1.0.0.1:53"
      - "--serversTransport.insecureSkipVerify=true"
    volumes:
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
      - ./data/acme.json:/acme.json

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Defining Kind Cluster Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Creates a YAML configuration file for a Kind cluster with one control-plane and two worker nodes, including resource reservations and eviction policies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/development/kubernetes.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat > kind-config.yaml <<EOF
# three node (two workers) cluster config
kind: Cluster
apiVersion: kind.x-k8s.io/v1alpha4
nodes:
- role: control-plane
  kubeadmConfigPatches:
    - |
      kind: KubeletConfiguration
      apiVersion: kubelet.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
      kubeReserved:
        cpu: "250m"
        memory: "256Mi"
      systemReserved:
        cpu: "500m"
        memory: "512Mi"
      evictionHard:
        memory.available: "200Mi"
- role: worker
- role: worker
EOF
```

TITLE: Configuring docker-compose.yml with PUID/PGID with Docker Socket
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Homarr with a mounted Docker socket, using different PUID and PGID settings to allow Docker integration to work correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.15.0/advanced/running-as-different-user/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#     Homarr - A simple, yet powerful dashboard for your server.      #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
        - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
        - PUID=1000
        - PGID=999
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Homarr with Traefik
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose YAML configuration for Homarr when running behind Traefik reverse proxy, including necessary labels and network configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - BASE_URL=your.internal.dns.address.here.com
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    networks:
      - proxy
    labels:
      traefik.enable: true
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.rule: Host(`your.internal.dns.address.here.com`)
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.entrypoints: websecure
      traefik.http.routers.homarr-secure.app: homarr
      traefik.http.apps.homarr.loadbalancer.server.port: 7575

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Configuring Ingress for Homarr

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
service:
  enabled: true # Ensure the service is enabled for Ingress to route traffic
ingress:
  enabled: true
  ingressClassName: "traefik"
  annotations:
  # Add any additional annotations as needed
  hosts:
    - host: homarr.homelab.dev
      paths:
        - path: /
          pathType: ImplementationSpecific
  tls:
    - hosts:
        - "homarr.homelab.dev"
        - "www.homarr.homelab.dev"
      secretName: homelab-tls
```

TITLE: Traefik Docker Compose Configuration with Cloudflare
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Traefik with Cloudflare DNS challenge for certificate generation. This configuration works with the Homarr-Traefik setup and includes port forwarding, security options, and certificate resolver settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'

apps:
  traefik:
    image: traefik:latest
    container_name: traefik
    restart: unless-stopped
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    networks:
      - proxy
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 443:443
    environment:
      - CF_API_EMAIL=yourcfemail@here.com
      - CF_DNS_API_TOKEN=long-token-from-cf

    command:
      - "--log.level=DEBUG"
      - "--providers.docker=true"
      - "--providers.docker.exposedbydefault=false"
      - "--providers.docker.endpoint=unix:///var/run/docker.sock"
      - "--entrypoints.web.address=:80"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.to=websecure"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entryPoint.scheme=https"
      - "--entrypoints.web.http.redirections.entrypoint.permanent=true"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.address=:443"
      - "--entrypoints.websecure.http.tls.certResolver=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesresolvers.cloudflare.acme.storage=acme.json"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.email=yourcfemail@here.com"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnsChallenge=true"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.provider=cloudflare"
      - "--certificatesResolvers.cloudflare.acme.dnschallenge.resolvers=1.1.1.1:53,1.0.0.1:53"
      - "--serversTransport.insecureSkipVerify=true" # Or proxmox gives an error 500 due to its own self-signed cert

    volumes:
      - /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
      - ./data/acme.json:/acme.json

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Configuring OIDC Authentication for Homarr with Authelia
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set up OIDC authentication for Homarr using Authelia as the OIDC provider. It includes the YAML configuration for Authelia and the necessary environment variables for Homarr.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
identity_providers:
oidc:
...
clients:
- id: homarr
  secret: <secret_hash>
  public: false
  authorization_policy: one_factor
  redirect_uris:
  - https://example.com/api/auth/callback/oidc
  - http://localhost:3000/api/auth/callback/oidc
  scopes:
  - openid
  - groups
  - profile
  - email
  userinfo_signing_algorithm: none
  consent_mode: implicit # self hosted
```

LANGUAGE: docker
CODE:
```
AUTH_PROVIDERS="oidc"
AUTH_OIDC_ISSUER="https://auth.example.com"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_SECRET="client_secret"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_ID="homarr"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_NAME="Authelia"
```

TITLE: Docker Compose with Socket Mount Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Extended Docker Compose configuration that includes Docker socket mounting and appropriate group permissions for Docker integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/running-as-different-user/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#     Homarr - A simple, yet powerful dashboard for your server.      #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
        - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
        - PUID=1000
        - PGID=999
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

TITLE: Retrieving Plex Authentication Token Using JavaScript

```

```

TITLE: Configuring Helm Chart Parameters for Homarr Deployment

TITLE: Configuring Ingress for Homarr
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration example for setting up Ingress to expose Homarr, including host, paths, and TLS configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/getting-started/installation/helm.md#2025-04-17_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
service:
  enabled: true # Ensure the service is enabled for Ingress to route traffic
ingress:
  enabled: true
  className: "traefik"
  annotations:
  # Add any additional annotations as needed
  hosts:
    - host: homarr.homelab.dev
      paths:
        - path: /
          pathType: ImplementationSpecific
  tls:
    - hosts:
        - "homarr.homelab.dev"
        - "www.homarr.homelab.dev"
      secretName: homelab-tls
```

```
| Date format               | How the date should look like                                                         | <ul><li>Monday, December 16</li><li>Monday, 16 December</li><li>Dec 16</li><li>16 Dec</li><li>16/12/2024</li><li>12/16/2024</li><li>16/12</li><li>12/16</li></ul> | Monday, December 16 |
```

TITLE: Helm Chart Configuration Parameters in Markdown Table Format
DESCRIPTION: Table of Helm chart configuration parameters showing setting keys, types, default values, and descriptions. The table includes settings for RBAC, health probes, replicas, resources, security context, service configuration, and node tolerations.

```
| rbac.enabled | bool | `false` | Enable to create RBAC resources and activate Kubernetes integration |
| readinessProbe.httpGet.path | string | `"/api/health/ready"` | This is the readiness check endpoint used by Kubernetes to determine if the application is ready to handle traffic. |
| readinessProbe.httpGet.port | int | `7575` | The port on which the readiness check will be performed. This must match the container's exposed port. |
| replicaCount | int | `1` | Number of replicas |
| resources | object | `{}` | Resource configuration |
| securityContext | object | `{}` | Security context |
| service.enabled | bool | `true` | Enable service |
| service.ports.app.port | int | `7575` | Service port |
| service.ports.app.protocol | string | `"TCP"` | Service protocol |
| service.ports.app.targetPort | string | `"http"` | Service target port |
| service.type | string | `"ClusterIP"` | Service type |
| tolerations | list | `[]` | Node tolerations for pod scheduling |
```

TITLE: Securing Homarr with Traefik Reverse Proxy
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for integrating Homarr with Traefik reverse proxy. The configuration includes necessary network settings and Traefik labels for proper routing and TLS termination.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - BASE_URL=your.internal.dns.address.here.com
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    networks:
      - proxy
    labels:
      traefik.enable: true
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.rule: Host(`your.internal.dns.address.here.com`)
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.entrypoints: websecure
      traefik.http.routers.homarr-secure.app: homarr
      traefik.http.apps.homarr.loadbalancer.server.port: 7575

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Defining Kind Cluster Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for creating a three-node Kubernetes cluster with one control plane and two worker nodes, including resource reservations and eviction policies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/advanced/development/kubernetes.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat > kind-config.yaml <<EOF
# three node (two workers) cluster config
kind: Cluster
apiVersion: kind.x-k8s.io/v1alpha4
nodes:
- role: control-plane
  kubeadmConfigPatches:
    - |
      kind: KubeletConfiguration
      apiVersion: kubelet.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
      kubeReserved:
        cpu: "250m"
        memory: "256Mi"
      systemReserved:
        cpu: "500m"
        memory: "512Mi"
      evictionHard:
        memory.available: "200Mi"
- role: worker
- role: worker
EOF
```

```
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - BASE_URL=your.internal.dns.address.here.com
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    networks:

    labels:
      traefik.enable: true
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.rule: Host(`your.internal.dns.address.here.com`)
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.entrypoints: websecure
      traefik.http.routers.homarr-secure.app: homarr
      traefik.http.apps.homarr.loadbalancer.server.port: 7575

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Patching Metrics Server for Insecure TLS
DESCRIPTION: Modifies the Metrics Server deployment to disable TLS verification, allowing it to communicate with kubelets using self-signed certificates in local environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/development/kubernetes.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
kubectl patch -n kube-system deployment metrics-server --type=json \
  -p '[{"op":"add","path":"/spec/template/spec/containers/0/args/-","value":"--kubelet-insecure-tls"}]'
```

TITLE: Securing Homarr with Traefik using Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Homarr with Traefik labels for reverse proxy setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - BASE_URL=your.internal.dns.address.here.com
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    networks:
      - proxy
    labels:
      traefik.enable: true
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.rule: Host(`your.internal.dns.address.here.com`)
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.entrypoints: websecure
      traefik.http.routers.homarr-secure.app: homarr
      traefik.http.apps.homarr.loadbalancer.server.port: 7575

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Proxmox API Token Configuration Steps
DESCRIPTION: Step-by-step instructions for creating and configuring a Proxmox API token for use with Homarr's System Health Monitoring widget. Includes detailed steps for setting up user groups, permissions, and API token generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/integrations/hardware.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
1. Navigate to the Proxmox portal, click on Datacenter
2. Expand Permissions, click on Groups
3. Click the Create button
4. Name the group something informative, like api-users
5. Click on the Permissions "folder"
6. Click Add -> Group Permission
    * Path: /
    * Group: group from Step 4 above
    * Role: PVEAuditor
    * Propagate: Checked
7. Expand Permissions, click on Users
8. Click the Add button
    * User name: something informative like api
    * Realm: Proxmox VE authentication server
    * Password: create a secure password for the user
    * Confirm Password: re-enter the password
    * Group: group from Step 4 above
9. Expand Permissions, click on API Tokens
10. Click the Add button
    * User: user from Step 8 above
    * Token ID: something informative like the application or purpose like homarr
    * Privilege Separation: unchecked
11. Copy the Secret that is shown in Step 10 because it is only shown once
12. Go back to the "Permissions" menu
13. Click Add -> API Token Permission
    * Path: /
    * API Token: select the API token created in Step 10
    * Role: PVE Auditor
    * Propagate: Checked
```

TITLE: Configuring OIDC Authentication for Homarr with Azure
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure OIDC authentication for Homarr using Azure Active Directory. It includes the necessary environment variables for connecting to an Azure app registration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: docker
CODE:
```
AUTH_PROVIDERS="oidc"
AUTH_OIDC_ISSUER="https://login.microsoftonline.com/<teanant-id>/v2.0"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_SECRET="<client-secret>"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_ID="<client-id>"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_NAME="Azure"
AUTH_OIDC_SCOPE_OVERWRITE="openid email profile" # Groups scope does not exist in azure
AUTH_OIDC_GROUPS_ATTRIBUTE="roles" # We use the roles of the app registration so that we don't need to use uuids as our groups
```

TITLE: Configuring LDAP Authentication for Homarr using Docker
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set up LDAP authentication for Homarr using Docker. It includes the necessary environment variables for connecting to an LDAP server, specifically using lldap as an example.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: docker
CODE:
```
docker run ...
AUTH_PROVIDERS="ldap"
AUTH_LDAP_URI="ldap://example.com:3890"
AUTH_LDAP_BASE="dc=example,dc=com" // Same as LLDAP_LDAP_BASE_DN
AUTH_LDAP_BIND_DN="uid=admin,ou=People,dc=example,dc=com"
AUTH_LDAP_BIND_PASSWORD="adminpass" // Same as LLDAP_LDAP_USER_PASS
```

TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Homarr with Self-Signed Certificates
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose YAML configuration for Homarr, including environment variable to allow self-signed certificates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED: 0
      SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY: your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

TITLE: Basic Docker Compose Configuration with Custom User
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Homarr with custom user permissions using PUID and PGID environment variables. Includes volume mounting and port configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/running-as-different-user/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#     Homarr - A simple, yet powerful dashboard for your server.      #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
        - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
        - PUID=1000
        - PGID=1000
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

TITLE: Caddy Docker Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for running Homarr with Caddy as reverse proxy including volume and network settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  caddy:
    container_name: caddy
    image: caddy:2
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 443:443
      - 443:443/udp
    volumes:
      - ./Caddyfile:/etc/caddy/Caddyfile
      - caddy_data:/data
      - caddy_config:/config
    networks:
      - proxy

volumes:
  caddy_data:
  caddy_config:

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```

TITLE: Patching Metrics Server for Local Development
DESCRIPTION: Command to disable TLS verification for the Metrics Server in local development environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.15.0/advanced/development/kubernetes.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

  -p '[{"op":"add","path":"/spec/template/spec/containers/0/args/-","value":"--kubelet-insecure-tls"}]'
```

TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose with Self-Signed Certificate Support
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Homarr with NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED environment variable set to 0, allowing Homarr to accept self-signed certificates when communicating with other applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yml
CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#                Homarr -  A homepage for your server.                #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED: 0
      SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY: your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

```
| Configuration        | Description                                                                                                                    | Values                                                                                                                                                            | Default Value       |
| -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------- |

| Use a fixed timezone | In case you want to show a timezone different from where you currently are. When enabled, you must choose from a timezone list | yes / no                                                                                                                                                          | no                  |

| Date format          | How the date should look like                                                                                                  | <ul><li>Monday, December 16</li><li>Monday, 16 December</li><li>Dec 16</li><li>16 Dec</li><li>16/12/2024</li><li>12/16/2024</li><li>16/12</li><li>12/16</li></ul> | Monday, December 16 |
| Custom time format   | You can define a custom time format.                                                                                           | Use the [ISO 8601](https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format#list-of-all-available-formats) format for time | - |
| Custom date format   | You can define a custom date format.                                                                                           | Use the [ISO 8601](https://day.js.org/docs/en/display/format#list-of-all-available-formats) format for dates | - |
```

TITLE: Azure App Registration OIDC Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Environment variable configuration for connecting Homarr to Microsoft Azure for OIDC authentication, using roles instead of groups for permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: docker
CODE:
```
AUTH_PROVIDERS="oidc"
AUTH_OIDC_ISSUER="https://login.microsoftonline.com/<teanant-id>/v2.0"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_SECRET="<client-secret>"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_ID="<client-id>"
AUTH_OIDC_CLIENT_NAME="Azure"
AUTH_OIDC_SCOPE_OVERWRITE="openid email profile" # Groups scope does not exist in azure
AUTH_OIDC_GROUPS_ATTRIBUTE="roles" # We use the roles of the app registration so that we don't need to use uuids as our groups
```

TITLE: Updating Docker Compose Configuration for Homarr
DESCRIPTION: Modified docker-compose.yml file to include the new SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY environment variable. This configuration also sets up volumes for Docker integration and app data, and exposes the necessary port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/blog/2024/12-31-migrate-secret-enryption-key/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:beta
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock # Optional, only if you want docker integration
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

```
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Bold                   | Makes the selected text bold                                        |
| Italic                 | Tilts the selected text                                             |
| Strikethrough          | Puts a bar through the selected text                                |
| Color text             | Changes the color of the text                                       |
| Colored highlight text | Highlights the text with a chosen color                             |
| Code                   | Elevates the text to a box                                          |
| Clear formatting       | Erases any of the preceding function's effects on the selected text |
```

TITLE: Authelia OIDC Client Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for setting up Authelia as an OIDC provider for Homarr.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
identity_providers:
oidc:
...
clients:
- id: homarr
  secret: <secret_hash>
  public: false
  authorization_policy: one_factor
  redirect_uris:
  - https://example.com/api/auth/callback/oidc
  - http://localhost:3000/api/auth/callback/oidc
  scopes:
  - openid
  - groups
  - profile
  - email
  userinfo_signing_algorithm: none
  consent_mode: implicit # self hosted
```

TITLE: Configuring Helm Chart Parameters for Service Deployment
DESCRIPTION: This YAML-like structure defines various configuration parameters for a Helm chart. It includes settings for readiness probes, replica count, resource allocation, security context, service configuration, and node tolerations. These parameters allow for customization of the service deployment in a Kubernetes environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/getting-started/installation/helm.md#2025-04-17_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
readinessProbe.httpGet.port: 7575
replicaCount: 1
resources: {}
securityContext: {}
service.enabled: true
service.ports.app.port: 7575
service.ports.app.protocol: "TCP"
service.ports.app.targetPort: "http"
service.type: "ClusterIP"
tolerations: []
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
journalctl -u homarr | tail -n 100
```

TITLE: Opening Console in Web Browser
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for opening the browser console to access client-side logs and debug information for Homarr.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/docs/community/faq.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
Open your browser and ensure, that Homarr is your current tab.
Press ``CTRL`` + ``SHIFT`` + ``I`` on your keyboard. If this shortcut doesn't work, please use one of the alternatives: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/open/.
Click on ``Console`` in the new window, that opened. There, you should see white, orange and sometimes red messages. You can use the Windows Snip & Sketch tool (or your respective tool on Linux / MacOS) to screenshot those messages.

> Please never execute any commands in the console. Scammers are using the console to let you execute harmful commands. If you want to resolve an issue in Homarr, **you'll never have to execute any commands here**
```

TITLE: Configuring Docker Run with Self-Signed Certificate Support
DESCRIPTION: Docker run command for Homarr with the NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED environment variable set to 0, which allows Homarr to accept self-signed certificates when communicating with other applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run  \
  --name homarr \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 7575:7575 \
  -v ./homarr/appdata:/appdata \
  -e NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 \
  -e SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string \
  -d ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
```

TITLE: Displaying Tabbed Content in React for Homarr Documentation
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to use the Tabs and TabItem components from the theme to create tabbed content in the documentation. It shows two tabs for reading console logs and server logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.15.0/community/faq.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<Tabs>
  <TabItem value="apple" label="Read console" default>

> Note: This will not work on most mobile browsers.

Open your browser and ensure, that Homarr is your current tab.
Press ``CTRL`` + ``SHIFT`` + ``I`` on your keyboard. If this shortcut doesn't work, please use one of the alternatives: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/open/.
Click on ``Console`` in the new window, that opened. There, you should see white, orange and sometimes red messages. You can use the Windows Snip & Sketch tool (or your respective tool on Linux / MacOS) to screenshot those messages.

> Please never execute any commands in the console. Scammers are using the console to let you execute harmful commands. If you want to resolve an issue in Homarr, **you'll never have to execute any commands here**

  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="orange" label="Read log">

This depends on your installation method. If you use Unraid, you can simply click on the App and on ``Log``. If you have a bare Docker install, use ``docker container logs homarr``. If you used a different name than ``homarr`` for your container, you need to replace said argument. Here is some additional information about the command: https://geekflare.com/check-docker-logs/.

  </TabItem>
</Tabs>
```

DESCRIPTION: Default container port configuration that exposes TCP port 7575 for HTTP traffic.

TITLE: Defining Kind Cluster Configuration with Multiple Nodes
DESCRIPTION: Creates a YAML configuration file for a kind Kubernetes cluster with one control plane and two worker nodes, including resource allocations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/docs/advanced/development/kubernetes.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat > kind-config.yaml <<EOF
# three node (two workers) cluster config
kind: Cluster
apiVersion: kind.x-k8s.io/v1alpha4
nodes:
- role: control-plane
  kubeadmConfigPatches:
    - |
      kind: KubeletConfiguration
      apiVersion: kubelet.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
      kubeReserved:
        cpu: "250m"
        memory: "256Mi"
      systemReserved:
        cpu: "500m"
        memory: "512Mi"
      evictionHard:
        memory.available: "200Mi"
- role: worker
- role: worker
EOF
```

TITLE: Implementing Tabs Component in React for Console and Log Access Instructions
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates the use of the Tabs and TabItem components from the Docusaurus theme to create a tabbed interface for instructions on accessing console logs and server logs in Homarr.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/community/faq.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<Tabs>
  <TabItem value="apple" label="Read console" default>

> Note: This will not work on most mobile browsers.

Open your browser and ensure, that Homarr is your current tab.
Press ``CTRL`` + ``SHIFT`` + ``I`` on your keyboard. If this shortcut doesn't work, please use one of the alternatives: https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/open/.
Click on ``Console`` in the new window, that opened. There, you should see white, orange and sometimes red messages. You can use the Windows Snip & Sketch tool (or your respective tool on Linux / MacOS) to screenshot those messages.

> Please never execute any commands in the console. Scammers are using the console to let you execute harmful commands. If you want to resolve an issue in Homarr, **you'll never have to execute any commands here**

  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="orange" label="Read log">

This depends on your installation method. If you use Unraid, you can simply click on the App and on ``Log``. If you have a bare Docker install, use ``docker container logs homarr``. If you used a different name than ``homarr`` for your container, you need to replace said argument. Here is some additional information about the command: https://geekflare.com/check-docker-logs/.

  </TabItem>
</Tabs>
```

TITLE: Creating Markdown Table for Homarr Glossary
DESCRIPTION: This markdown snippet defines a table with two columns: 'Term' and 'Definition'. It lists and explains key concepts used in the Homarr project, providing a quick reference for users and developers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/getting-started/glossary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Term            | Definition                                                                                                     |
|-----------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Apps            | An piece of software that you or a third party hosts (eg. Google)                                              |
| Integration     | A connection to a service outside of Homarr                                                                    |
| Dynamic section | Resizeable area where items on your board can be placed and grouped                                            |
| Widget          | A tile that uses your integrations to display data or enables you to interact with with them                   |
| Edit mode       | Temporary state that you can enter where you can drag and drop, edit or customize your board                   |
| Board           | Customizable page which can be edited using the edit mode. This is where apps, sections and widgets are placed |
| Tasks           | Workloads that are performed in the background - even if there is no user present                              |
```

TITLE: Configuring IFrame Widget Options in Homarr
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table listing various configuration options for the IFrame widget in Homarr, including embed URL, fullscreen permissions, scrolling, transparency, and other security-related settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/widgets/iframe/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

CODE:
```
| Configuration      | Description                                                                                                       | Values   | Default Value |
| ------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------- | ------------- |
| Embed URL          | The page that should be embedded                                                                                  | URL      | -             |
| Allow full screen  | Allow pages inside the iframe to enter full screen                                                                | yes / no | no            |
| Allow scrolling    | Allows scrolling pass through to iframe                                                                           | yes / no | yes           |
| Allow transparency | Allows scrolling pass through from iframe (board transparency settings do not impact the iframe, only the border) | yes / no | no            |
| Allow payment      | Allow payment information pass through to iframe                                                                  | yes / no | no            |
| Allow auto play    | Allows videos to autoplay                                                                                         | yes / no | no            |
| Allow microphone   | Allows microphone pass through to iframe                                                                          | yes / no | no            |
| Allow camera       | Allows camera pass through to iframe                                                                              | yes / no | no            |
| Allow geolocation  | Allows geolocation pass through to iframe                                                                         | yes / no | no            |
```

```
cp ./node_modules/better-sqlite3/build/Release/better_sqlite3.node ./build/better_sqlite3.node
```

TITLE: Creating a Styled Button Link for Community Apps Installation
DESCRIPTION: This JSX code creates a styled button link using the imported Link and IconDownload components. The button directs users to the Community Apps plugin installation page and includes custom styling and an event tracker.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.12.0/getting-started/installation/unraid.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<Link
  data-umami-event="Install Unraid Community Apps"
  className={'button button--secondary button--lg rounded-3xl dark:border-zinc-600 dark:bg-zinc-800'}
  to="https://forums.unraid.net/topic/38582-plug-in-community-applications/"
>

    <span className={"dark:text-gray-200"}>Install community applications plugin</span>
    <IconDownload className={"dark:text-gray-200"} size={20} />
  </div>
</Link>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Table - Common Text Formatting Functions
DESCRIPTION: Table showing the available text formatting functions and their descriptions in the Notebook widget toolbar.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/widgets/notebook/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Function               | Description                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Bold                   | Makes the selected text bold                                        |
| Italic                 | Tilts the selected text                                             |
| Strikethrough          | Puts a bar through the selected text                                |
| Color text             | Changes the color of the text                                       |
| Colored highlight text | Highlights the text with a chosen color                             |
| Code                   | Elevates the text to a box                                          |
| Clear formatting       | Erases any of the preceding function's effects on the selected text |
```

TITLE: Configuring Downloads Widget Options in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table detailing the configuration options for the Downloads widget. It includes options for column display, sorting, usenet entries, category filtering, and whitelist functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/widgets/downloads/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Configuration                           | Description                          | Values                                                                                               | Default Value                                                                                        |
| --------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Columns to show                         | Defines what columns should be shown | <ul><li>Integration</li><li>Job name</li><li>Progress</li><li>Finish time</li><li>Controls</li></ul> | <ul><li>Integration</li><li>Job name</li><li>Progress</li><li>Finish time</li><li>Controls</li></ul> |
| Enable items sorting                    | Enables the sorting in the table     | yes / no                                                                                             | no                                                                                                   |
| Show usenet entries marked as completed | Also show completed usenet downloads | yes / no                                                                                             | yes                                                                                                  |
| Categories / labels to filter           | Filter the categories and labels     | list                                                                                                 | empty list                                                                                           |
| Filter as a whitelist                   | Invert the above filter              | yes / no                                                                                             | no                                                                                                   |
```

TITLE: Enabling Internal MySQL Database
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to enable the internal MySQL database provided by the chart dependency.


TITLE: Cluster Verification Commands
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to verify the cluster setup and metrics server deployment.

```
kubectl get nodes
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
kubectl top nodes
```

TITLE: Setting Directory Permissions with Docker Group
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create and set appropriate permissions for the Homarr appdata directory with Docker group access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/advanced/running-as-different-user/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_5

CODE:
```
mkdir -p ./homarr/appdata
chown -R 1000:999 ./homarr/appdata
```

TITLE: Modifying Mantine CSS Variables in Homarr
DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet demonstrates how to change the primary color of Homarr by modifying Mantine's CSS variables. It sets the filled primary color to a custom yellow shade.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/styling/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
:root {
    --mantine-primary-color-filled: #ffbb00;
}
```


LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:
```
<Link
```

TITLE: Configuring Ingress for Homarr
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to set up Ingress for Homarr, including host, paths, and TLS settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/getting-started/installation/helm.md#2025-04-17_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
service:
  enabled: true # Ensure the service is enabled for Ingress to route traffic
ingress:
  enabled: true
  ingressClassName: "traefik"
  annotations:
  # Add any additional annotations as needed
  hosts:
    - host: homarr.homelab.dev
      paths:
        - path: /
          pathType: ImplementationSpecific
  tls:
    - hosts:
        - "homarr.homelab.dev"
        - "www.homarr.homelab.dev"
      secretName: homelab-tls
```

TITLE: Markdown Table of Homarr Terminology
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table defining key terms used in Homarr including apps, integrations, dynamic sections, widgets, edit mode, boards and tasks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/getting-started/glossary.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Term            | Definition                                                                                                     |
|-----------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Apps            | An piece of software that you or a third party hosts (eg. Google)                                              |
| Integration     | A connection to a service outside of Homarr                                                                    |
| Dynamic section | Resizeable area where items on your board can be placed and grouped                                            |
| Widget          | A tile that uses your integrations to display data or enables you to interact with with them                   |
| Edit mode       | Temporary state that you can enter where you can drag and drop, edit or customize your board                   |
| Board           | Customizable page which can be edited using the edit mode. This is where apps, sections and widgets are placed |
| Tasks           | Workloads that are performed in the background - even if there is no user present                              |
```

TITLE: Using Tabs Component in React/JSX
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to implement a tabbed interface using the Tabs component. It shows a tab group with two tab items, 'apple' and 'orange', each containing different content. The component uses JSX syntax for structuring the tabs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.13.1/advanced/single-sign-on/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: jsx
CODE:

```
    This is an apple 
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="orange" label="Orange">
    This is an orange 
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>
```

TITLE: Installing Homarr Using Traditional Helm Repository
DESCRIPTION: Commands to add the Homarr Helm repository, update repositories, and install the Homarr chart using the traditional Helm repository approach.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/getting-started/installation/helm.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
helm repo add homarr-labs https://homarr-labs.github.io/charts/
helm repo update
helm install homarr homarr-labs/homarr
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring docker-compose.yml with PUID/PGID without Docker Socket
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Homarr with custom user and group IDs (PUID/PGID) without Docker socket integration. Includes environment variables for security and user permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.11.0/advanced/running-as-different-user/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
#     Homarr - A simple, yet powerful dashboard for your server.      #
#---------------------------------------------------------------------#
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
        - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
        - PUID=1000
        - PGID=1000
    ports:
      - '7575:7575'
```

TITLE: Installing Homarr with Custom Time Zone
DESCRIPTION: Example of installing Homarr with a custom time zone parameter using the --set flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.10.0/getting-started/installation/helm.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
helm install homarr \
  --set env.TZ="America/New York" \
    homarr-labs/homarr
```

TITLE: Securing Homarr with Traefik in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for Homarr with Traefik labels for reverse proxy and SSL termination. Includes network configuration for proper integration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/homarr-labs/documentation/blob/master/versioned_docs/version-1.14.0/advanced/proxy/index.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'
services:
  homarr:
    container_name: homarr
    image: ghcr.io/homarr-labs/homarr:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./homarr/appdata:/appdata
    environment:
      - BASE_URL=your.internal.dns.address.here.com
      - SECRET_ENCRYPTION_KEY=your_64_character_hex_string # <--- can be generated with `openssl rand -hex 32`
    networks:
      - proxy
    labels:
      traefik.enable: true
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.rule: Host(`your.internal.dns.address.here.com`)
      traefik.http.routers.homarr.entrypoints: websecure
      traefik.http.routers.homarr-secure.app: homarr
      traefik.http.apps.homarr.loadbalancer.server.port: 7575

networks:
  proxy:
    external: true
```
